main event: A witness reported a sighting of a red and green ground object moving rapidly near Ft. Collins, Colorado in September 1956.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 1 hour but was ruled to be an optical illusion rather than actual motion., The sighting lasted for less than 1 minute of direct observation time., The object was described as being the size of a baseball., Star Vega was overhead at the time, raising the possibility of misidentification with astronomical phenomena., The source of the report was military, adding credibility to the observation.
sighted object: one ground object, size of a baseball, colored red and green
